bibl.title: G.M. Savage v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the matter of the Application of G.M. Savage for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon. John P. Hoyt Judge of the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Olympia.
The petition of G.M. Savage respectfully show
That he is unlawfully detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County Wash. Ter. at Olympia in said County and Territory.

That the Court which issued the procus or pretended procus under which petitioner is so confined and restrained as aforesaid, wit the Probate Court of Chehalis County Washington Territory was without jurisdiction over petitioner, and that said procus or pretended procus was issued without authority of law. and second that said procus is in ratio upon its face.

Therefore your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus may be granted to the said William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County as aforesaid commanding him to have the body of petitioner before your Hon at a time and place therein to be specified. To do and receive what shall then and there be confined by your Hon concerning him, together with the time and cause of such confinement restraint and detention, and said writ, and that he may be returned to his liberty.
Dated on the 29th day of March 1884. G M Savage
Territory of Washington County of Thurston }
I, G.M. Savage being duly sworn depose and say on oath that I have read the foregoing petition and know the contents thereof and herein the same to be true
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 29th day of March 1884.
Thomas Henry Judge of the Probate Court Thurston County Wash. Ter.
